lines.text:
[when ordering Andy to disrobe for his beating]
I said SKIN!
Why's he get so burned up just 'cause I talk about Frances? She hasn't been around in a couple weeks. More. The way they were getting along, I thought they'd end up being married.
How long you, your dad and I live together?
About sixteen years, since my mother died.
Yeah, since then. Sixteen years to learn better than to ask me something that your father won't tell you.
Next time you see somebody drop money, don't think about it so long before you decide to give it back.
You ought to. You spent a long time on 'em.
You don't have to know people long. I mean... Well, doesn't it ever happen to you? You meet somebody and you take one look and you know they're all right.
I mean, each of us has got secret things deep inside, and if we don't have someone we can share them with, we usually go all haywire. That's what I mean by lonely.
Were you laughing at me? Were you still thinking I was wet behind the ears and smelled of milk? Were ya?
I couldn't quite tell for sure, but I got the impression you were packing a gun.
In that case I guess I can take the time to find out whatever your beef is, or were you just planning to shoot me without letting me in on the secret?
